messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Learned something today
messages.msgSnippet: -=- I ve fallen into the trap of spending too much time reading about homeschooling/unschooling and not enough time actually putting it into practice.-=-
messages.messageBody:
-=- I've fallen into the trap of spending too much time reading about homeschooling/unschooling and not enough time actually putting it into practice.-=-

There's a cure, or a tool for that.

Read a little, try a little, wait a while, watch.
And maybe when you read, at first, include some of this:
http://sandradodd.com/being




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Learned something today
messages.msgSnippet: I am still in the early experimental phase of unschooling.  Its been a slow, but rewarding process. One of the things I have heard many times from wise people
messages.messageBody:
I am still in the early experimental phase of unschooling. Its been a slow, but rewarding process.
One of the things I have heard many times from wise people on this email list is "Be present with your kids." I thought I have been doing well with that, as we are more often than not, together.
I was with three of my kids at the movies this afternoon. I was reading some emails while we were waiting for our movie to start. Some advertisements were playing and my 6 year old tapped my arm and said, "Mommy, you're not watching this with me." I realized then that while I am usually with them physically, my mind is often elsewhere, and they know it. I've fallen into the trap of spending too much time reading about homeschooling/unschooling and not enough time actually putting it into practice.

Sheryl



Sent from my iPhone
